p: Currently, researchers are more captivated by plant-based bioactives, which provide health benefits owing to the presence of high-value secondary metabolites. In the current world healthcare scenario, more than 80% of the world population, particularly in developing countries, trusts phytomedicines for the therapeutic needs ( 1). Still prevailing success of traditional systems of therapies such as Ayurveda, Greco-Arab (Unani-Tibb), and Chinese medicine system is due to the fact that phytomedicines have fewer side effects and are economical ( 2- 4).
